item.title: Psalm 88
item.dc:creator: pathogenicus
item.description:
A song or Psalm of Heman the Ezrahite to give instruction, committed to the sons of Korah for him that excelleth upon Mahalath Leannoth.1 O Lord God of my salvation, I cry day and night before thee.2 Let my prayer enter into thy presence: incline thine ear unto my cry.3 For my soul is filled […]

The post Psalm 88 appeared first on Pathogenicus.
item.content:encoded:
A song or Psalm of Heman the Ezrahite to give instruction, committed to the sons of Korah for him that excelleth upon Mahalath Leannoth.

1 O Lord God of my salvation, I cry day and night before thee.

2 Let my prayer enter into thy presence: incline thine ear unto my cry.

3 For my soul is filled with evils, and my life draweth near to the grave.

4 I am counted among them that go down unto the pit, and am as a man without strength,

5 Free among the dead, like the slain laying in the grave, when thou rememberest no more, and they are cut off from thy hand.

6 Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, and in the deep.

7 Thine indignation lieth upon me, and thou hast vexed me with all thy waves. Selah.

8 Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me, and made me to be abhorred of them: I am shut up, and cannot get forth.

9 Mine eye is sorrowful through mine affliction: Lord, I call daily upon thee: I stretch out mine hands unto thee.

10 Wilt thou show a miracle to the dead? or shall the dead rise and praise thee? Selah.

11 Shall thy loving kindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?

12 Shall thy wondrous works be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of oblivion?

13 But unto thee, have I cried, O Lord, and early shall my prayer come before thee.

14 Lord, why dost thou reject my soul, and hidest thy face from me?

15 I am afflicted and at the point of death: from my youth I suffer thy terrors, doubting of my life.

16 Thine indignations go over me, and thy fear hath cut me off.

17 They came round about me daily like water, and compassed me together.

18 My lovers and friends hast thou put away from me, and mine acquaintance hid themselves.

Geneva Bible, 1599 Edition. Published by Tolle Lege Press. All rights reserved. No part of this publication may be reproduced or transmitted in any form or by any means, electronic or mechanical, without written permission from the publisher, except in the case of brief quotations in articles, reviews, and broadcasts.

The post Psalm 88 appeared first on Pathogenicus.

item.content:encoded:
the buildup ofv the end, or afterwards.

so here I must conclude

rather "start" [the transition?]

shadow management - I guess

let's 

to look at one's own and become another

I say, yes, FORSAKE

ov prelude.that will have to come for laterthe end is now upon usthat is, me and my shadowthe two of us, are at a "whatcha’mah callit"so that will be where we will have to "start"or "begin", of this trailThe path will be of post, to and from, here-there-hereof wraith and ghost and spirit and undeath

The post mmxxiii-ii-xxvii-mdccxxxv appeared first on Pathogenicus.
item.content:encoded:
ov prelude.

that will have to come for later

the end is now upon us

that is, me and my shadow

the two of us, are at a "whatcha’mah callit"

so that will be where we will have to "start"

or "begin", of this trail

The path will be of post, to and from, here-there-here

of wraith and ghost and spirit and undeath

The post mmxxiii-ii-xxvii-mdccxxxv appeared first on Pathogenicus.

item.title: mmxxiii-ii-xxvii-cxiii
item.dc:creator: pathogenicus
item.description:
Nobody, the nameless un-one: Ydobon.Who were they?Only time will tell.Who am I?I am me.But, not myself!For, we aren’t.Lest, we were.And, therein lies this;The misfortune.

The post mmxxiii-ii-xxvii-cxiii appeared first on Pathogenicus.
item.content:encoded:
Nobody, the nameless un-one: Ydobon.

Who were they?

Only time will tell.

Who am I?

I am me.

But, not myself!

For, we aren’t.

Lest, we were.

And, therein lies this;
The misfortune.

The post mmxxiii-ii-xxvii-cxiii appeared first on Pathogenicus.
